column1: Muzaffarabad (Urdu: مُظفّر آباد‎) is the capital of the Pakistan-administered territory of Azad Jammu and Kashmir. It is the largest city of Azad Kashmir and 60th largest in Pakistan.
The city is located in Muzaffarabad District near the confluence of the Jhelum and Neelum rivers. The district is bounded by the province of Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa in the west
column2: by the Kupwara and Baramulla districts of Indian-administered Jammu and Kashmir in the east
column3: and the Neelum District of Azad Kashmir in the north.

column1: Muzaffarabad was founded in 1646 by Sultan Muzaffar Khan chief of the Bomba who ruled Kashmir. Sultan Muzaffar Khan also completed Muzaffarabad's Red Fort that same year to ward off incursions from the Mughal Empire.
The city was near the epicenter of the 2005 Kashmir earthquake
column2: which had a magnitude of 7.6. The earthquake destroyed about 50% of the buildings in the city (including most of the official buildings) and is estimated to have killed up to 80
column3: 000 people in the Pakistani-controlled areas of Kashmir. As of 8 October 2005 the Pakistani government's official death toll was 87
column4: 350.  Some estimates put the death toll over 100

column1: The district of Muzaffarabad is administratively subdivided into 02 tehsils
column2: which are sub-divided into 25 Union Councils

column1: The nearest railway station is located in Rawalpindi District.
